field.name: help
field.p: An account is part of a ledger allowing your company to register all kinds of debit and credit transactions. Companies present their annual accounts in two main parts: the balance sheet and the income statement (profit and loss account). The annual accounts of a company are required by law to disclose a certain amount of information.

field.name: help
field.p: A journal is used to record transactions of all accounting data related to the day-to-day business.

field.name: help
field.p: Journal group are used in reporting to display relevant data together.

div.p: The closing balance is different than the computed one!
Confirming this will create automatically a journal entry with the difference in the profit/loss account set on the cash journal.

field.name: help
field.p: A bank statement is a summary of all financial transactions occurring over a given period of time on a bank account. You should receive this periodicaly from your bank.
Odoo allows you to reconcile a statement line directly with the related sale or puchase invoices.

field.name: help
field.p: A bank statement line is a financial transaction on a bank account
Odoo allows you to reconcile a statement line directly with the related sale or puchase invoice(s).

field.p: Those can be used to quickly create a journal items when reconciling a bank statement or an account.

field.name: help
field.p: An account type is used to determine how an account is used in each journal. The deferral method of an account type determines the process for the annual closing. Reports such as the Balance Sheet and the Profit and Loss report use the category (profit/loss or balance sheet).

field.name: help
field.p: A Cash Register allows you to manage cash entries in your cash journals. This feature provides an easy way to follow up cash payments on a daily basis. You can enter the coins that are in your cash box, and then post entries when money comes in or goes out of the cash box.
